From GTC to Website Building with AI Tools

Episode 9 April 25, 2025
Featuring: Jason Hand, Ryan MacLean

Fresh from NVIDIA‚Äôs GTC conference where 25,000 developers gathered to see where AI is heading next, Jason and Ryan bring back field reports from the trenches of production AI. The conference buzz revealed a new worry keeping developers up at night: ‚Äúwallet attacks‚Äù‚Äîcompetitors deliberately triggering your AI APIs to drain your budget. Between tales of robots learning to navigate warehouses and autonomous vehicles taking over highways, Jason showcases the fruits of his own AI-assisted labor: a complete website overhaul featuring a working feedback form, finally-fixed UI bugs, and search functionality that actually works. It‚Äôs proof that while the world dreams of AI taking over, sometimes the real victory is just getting your CSS to behave.

Jump To

Key Takeaways

  • The AI industry is shifting from curiosity to practical implementation, with GTC attendance growing to over 25,000 people
  • Many organizations are concerned with hallucination detection, security, and cost management as they move AI projects to production
  • Claude Code can efficiently help build websites and web applications with features like feedback forms and API integrations
  • AI tools like Claude Code can resolve long-standing bugs and improve UI/UX in existing projects
  • The concept of "wallet attacks" (competitors trying to exhaust your API quotas) is an emerging concern in AI deployment
  • Serverless functions can help overcome CORS limitations when building web applications that integrate with third-party APIs
